medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent abdominal pain and chylous serum.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced recurrent mild abdominal pain and diarrhea since he was 17 years old. He was admitted in 1973 at the age of 22. Acute pancreatitis requiring hospitalization had recurred 22 times over 31 years, usually triggered by a diet rich in fat. His abdominal pain resolved after cessation of the diet and infusion of protease inhibitors. The onset of acute pancreatitis appeared at lower serum triglyceride concentrations over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Genetically diagnosed with lipoprotein lipase (LPL) deficiency, homozygous for LPL Arita. Additionally, past history of recurrent mild abdominal pain and diarrhea since age 17.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother had type 2 diabetes mellitus but there was no family history of hyperlipidemia or pancreatitis.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was a current smoker (approximately 20 cigarettes per day) and consumed approximately 20 g of alcohol daily.
